edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Lol

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game
      • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Lol

  • public abstract class Lol
extends Game
    A Lol object is the outermost container for all of the functionality of the game. It implements ApplicationListener (through Game), which provides hooks for GDX to render the game, stop it, resume it, etc. Lol is not responsible for doing anything significant. It keeps track of which screen is currently in use, and forwards (through Game) to that screen. Splash screens, Choosers, Help, and playable Levels each implement Screen, so that they can do the real work.

      • onHeroCollideTrigger

        public abstract void onHeroCollideTrigger(int id,
                        int whichLevel,
                        Obstacle o,
                        Hero h)
        When a Hero collides with an Obstacle for which a HeroCollideTrigger has been set, this code will run
        Parameters:
        id - The number assigned to the Obstacle's HeroCollideTrigger
        whichLevel - The current level
        o - The obstacle involved in the collision
        h - The hero involved in the collision

        Parameters:

        whichLevel - The current level
        o - The entity involved in the collision

        whichLevel - The current level
        e - The enemy to which the timer was attached

        whichLevel - The current level

      • levelCompleteTrigger

        public abstract void levelCompleteTrigger(int whichLevel,
                        boolean win)
        When a level finishes, this code will run
        Parameters:
        whichLevel - The current level
        win - True if the level was won, false otherwise

        whichLevel - The current level

      • onControlPressEntityTrigger

        public abstract void onControlPressEntityTrigger(int id,
                               float val,
                               PhysicsSprite entity,
                               int whichLevel)
        When a Control is pressed, for which there is a ControlTrigger that takes an entity and value, this code will run.
        Parameters:
        id - The number assigned to this trigger
        val - The value that was sent by the control
        entity - The entity to modify via this control press
        whichLevel - The current level

      • onStrengthChangeTrigger

        public abstract void onStrengthChangeTrigger(int whichLevel,
                           Hero h)
        When a hero collides with a goodie or enemy, and it leads to the hero's strength changing, we can opt to run this code.
        Parameters:
        whichLevel - The current level
        h - The hero whose strength just changed
